@graph.description:
This artifact allows users to reproduce the SQLite baseline experiment from the VLDB '23 paper BrewER: Entity Resolution On-Demand. It provides a complete, end-to-end workflow packaged in a Jupyter notebook.

The artifact automates the following steps:

1. Provisions a bare metal server (Compute Cascade Lake R) on Chameleon Cloud.
2. Configures the Ubuntu environment, installs dependencies (including compiling SQLite 3.45), and patches the original code for bare-metal execution.
3. Downloads the survey_sample dataset via Git LFS.
4. Executes the entity resolution pipeline.
5. Calculates and reports Precision, Recall, and F1 scores (Header, Record, Cell) using a custom parallelized evaluation script.

By following this notebook, researchers can verify the reproducibility of the BrewER baseline results without manual setup.
@graph.disambiguatingDescription: A reproducible experiment running the BrewER entity resolution (SQLite baseline) on the survey_sample dataset, following the VLDB '23 methodology and packaged for Chameleon Trovi.
@graph.name: Reproducing the BrewER (VLDB '23) Entity Resolution Experiment
